location.recipe: Koláče (Czech Pastries) - Sweet pastries filled with poppy seeds, jam, or farmer's cheese, traditionally made by my grandmother every Purim.
location.story: My family immigrated from Czechoslovakia after WWII, preserving our unique minhagim including singing special tunes during Shabbat dinners passed down through generations.

location.recipe: Shakshuka - Eggs poached in spicy tomato sauce with peppers and onions, taught to me by my grandfather every Friday morning.
location.story: My family moved from Morocco to Jerusalem, bringing vibrant Sephardic customs like the special chanting style of Kiddush on Shabbat.

location.recipe: Classic Potato Kugel - A savory potato casserole recipe passed down from my great-grandmother, traditionally served during family gatherings and holidays.
location.story: Originally from Poland, my family settled in Los Angeles, keeping alive Ashkenazi traditions like gathering to bake challah together every Thursday night.
